ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] BEGGARS (was-Something Awful.com pokes fun at EQ)
ygData.msgSnippet: I really like to find the lvl 1s who just logged in and don t know where their guild is. I will take them to their guild, introduce them to their guildmaster
ygData.messageBody:
I really like to find the lvl 1s who just logged in and don't know where
their guild is. I will take them to their guild, introduce them to their
guildmaster and maybe give them some patchwork armor. I have been known to
give tours of Kelethin to new players or visitors to the area. And I'm
always more than happy to give peole details to quests so they can make xp.
:-)
Speaking of quests, I just finished my 3rd shawl queast (in Thurg) and am
starting on the 4th. :-)
Gonna go play that now. :-)
luv,
-Su

> Oooooh! What a conversation starter!
>
> G'Fay is famous for the /ooc beggar. I, like you, usually end up
"chiding"
> any beggar that pollutes the chat with a constant cry for platinum or even
> Power Leveling and gear. But, I have never been accused of being too harsh
> with someone. Most people start sending me tells agreeing with me about
> stupid beggars, and then they /ooc support to my discouragement of
begging.
> And NOTHING pisses me off more than the ungrateful player. I have on
> occasion given some plat or newbie gear to people that wouldn't stop
begging
> just to shut them up. And yes, I would say that most of the begging souls
> that I have donated anything to were just as ungrateful as the chap that
you
> described. They can't even bother to type 2 letters -TY- or God forbid
that
> they might actually /bow or /kneel or /thank... <:-P>
>
> I too often seek out young players above 3rd or 4th season that appear to
be
> working hard to advance themselves the way that most of us did as
> NewB's....and while I expect nothing in return for the small gifts that I
> give. I find that more often than not these players are very thankful and
> benevolent. It just makes me feel all warm and fuzzy to make some new
> player's day.
> I have found that it "pays" to work hard for the things that you want--in
RL
> and in EQ.
>
>
> I was going to say something about how all beggars should publicly die
slow
> cruel deaths in explicit detail, but I'll leave it to your imagination----
>
> Redfists Bakdafugup - Cleric of His Holiness, Brell Serilis
>
> ( I can be found on the Druzzil Ro server at odd times of the day and
night,
> feel free to say hello or even BEG from me, well that is to say that if
you
> would like to make the list of people that will never ever ever get a free
> or cheap REZ from me you should definitely beg.)
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
